user_query: to recognize Ember's ability to make glass at once It also shows a family side of her uncle, Harold, and her children, Marco and Polo, in the same house Wade often shows his weakness, but he does everything for his loved ones, so he's very much like the Italians and his family The name of Wade's nephew, Marco Ripple, and Polo Ripple, is thought to mean Marco Polo, a merchant and explorer who traveled around many countries to the extent that he wrote the Eastern Review Given that the entire Ripple family, including Wade, is a water element character, it is more likely that it was created for Marco Polo, a water play that children usually play in the West Clod, Ember's neighbor and smart girl, is a soil element character that grows flowers on her body Because it's a clay character, it has a solid-particle appearance, so it has to be different from other materials The soil element characters are not only flowers, but also oak, apple, and coniferous plants that grow according to their individuality Clod takes off the flowers that grow under his armpits and gives them to Ember, but she shows them burning them After the rebuilding of Firetown, Clod became friends with a fire girl of similar age and had a happy ending However, considering that he appears as the main character of Elemental's element poster, he is also the most non-existent poster character because he only shows a scene where he gives flowers to Ember and becomes close to a girl at the end But the reason why Clod was
